citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: Joint Ocean Ice Studies (JOIS), 1998-present

descript.abstract: US/Canada collaborative data, including hydrographic sections of the N. Pacific, Bering Sea, and Chukchi Sea. Coordinated with the SHEBA program. Suface and water column sample data, mooring data, underway surface samples.
descript.purpose: Providing information on the climate and ecosystems of the Canadian Arctic and Subarctic Pacific, Eastern Arctic circulation, measurement of currents along the North slope of Alaska, transport of Pacific waters through the Bering Strait, studies of the Canada Basin, Canadian Arctic Archipelago, and the Northwater Polynya, interannual variability especially with respect to El Nino, role of shelf currents in the migration of juvenile Sockeye salmon, and ocean currents relevant to the US GLOBEC program
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Some data not secured in regional data centre. Risk of Loss: Medium Impact Justification: Data are related to a subject, location or species of concern within the scientific, government or public community within the last 5 years. Impact of Loss: Low Recommended Action: Bring rest of data to archives

place.placekey: Northeast Pacific and Gulf of Alaska

idinfo.useconst: Some data may be subject to variable proprietary periods

dataqual.logic: Normal calibration of CTD instruments at IOS.

procstep.procdesc: Collaborators include: Japan Marine Science and Technology Center, NSF Arctic Research Initiatives, Department of Interior, Minerals Management Service, NSF Arctic Research Initiatives, NSF (GLOBEC Pacific), NOAA Marine Mammal Studies.
